TopicTitle: BSC Challenge: Rover + Skycrane - Yet another winner!

Articles.Content: YAY! Winners! Congrats to those that got to the top 3!

Congratulations Ravenchant, and to the runners up as well.

Heres looking forward to the next one. with the ability to tune control surfaces an SPH challenge should be good.

Oh wow. I wasn't even hoping to get into finals when submitting. Well...I don't think it was the best one, but hey, if people like it...

Deathsoul97, antbin - congratulations! The same goes for all participants for making such interesting designs, they were fun to test

Of course, a big thanks goes to Xeldrak for creating this challenge series and not losing his (?) nerves, and to anyone who voted for my entry on grounds of its functionality, and not looks

Edit: Oh hey, 100th post! Better say something witty, better say something witty... nope, I got nothing.
um dose anyone know when the next one will be?

Well, right now I don't know when the next one will be. I'm really busy with my university stuff this month, since I'll have to write several exams around the end of it.

I haven't forgotten BSC - it's just that real life has gotten the better of me.

BSC challenges are about the only thing I'm excited to check in at the forums for...

But yes, real life more important.

Well, right now I don't know when the next one will be. I'm really busy with my university stuff this month, since I'll have to write several exams around the end of it.

I haven't forgotten BSC - it's just that real life has gotten the better of me.

why not just hand the next one over for someone else to run?

an aweful spinoff...

Everything Sirine does makes me scratch my head...

Viel GlÃƒÂ¼ck I'm in a similar situation...going to be buried under differential equations and signal analysis for much of February-.-

I could run a spinoff. I'll look at Xeldrak's original posts and follow his format. I really like the way Xeldrak does things, so perhaps I'll create a new challenge on Wednesday. Sirine had a lot of rules, so I didn't enter his challenge. It was good, just not Xeldrak's style.

I have some knowledge of how to use Illustrator, so I could probably be capable of creating the same kind of graphic with thumbnails of all the entries. I sure do appreciate what Xeldrak did! Managing those challenges with the quality he did is a lot of work.

Edited January 30, 2014 by Andrew Hansen
I think we should wait for Xeldrak to weigh in before staging a spinoff, seems a bit disrespectful IMO

Hm, well I didn't realize that demand is that high.

I have another exam on Tuesday - if you guys are so eager for another challenge, I could set up a new BSC on Tuesday afternoon or Wednesday.
